name: Credstash V2 - Access Management Guide.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces guidelines that need to be considered when granting access to associates for using Credstash. It aims to provide an overview of the access management process, ensuring that proper measures are taken to secure sensitive information stored in Credstash.
use_cases: Granting access to associates for using Credstash
Securing sensitive information stored in Credstash
Implementing access control measures for Credstash

name: Credstash V2 - Access Management Guide.txt - What is Credstash?
description: This section introduces Credstash, a user interface tool developed by the DevOps team for managing secrets across various microservices. It highlights the high privilege level of this tool and the need for efficient handling of its features, which is why a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) guide is provided for the IT team.
use_cases: Centralized access control for sensitive information
Secure storage and retrieval of credentials

name: Credstash V2 - Access Management Guide.txt - Access Management
description: This section explains the access management process for the Credstash V2 system. It mentions that different Google groups have different levels of access and permissions to perform various actions within the system. The section emphasizes that each individual should belong to only one Google group at a time, and if their designation changes, they should be removed from their current group before being added to a new one.
use_cases: Controlling access and permissions for different user groups
Managing user group memberships based on job roles or designations
Ensuring users belong to only one access group at a time

name: Credstash V2 - Access Management Guide.txt - Stage Credstash [ Testing Platform ]
description: This section provides information about accessing the Credstash testing platform, which is a secure credential management system. It mentions that access is granted by adding associates to specific Google Groups. The section includes a link to the Credstash UI for the testing platform and lists three Google Groups: developers@razorpay.com, credstash-devs@razorpay.com, and credstash-dev-admins@razorpay.com. Associates should be added as members to these groups to gain access to the testing platform.
use_cases: Secure credential management for testing and development environments
Access control and management for associates working on the Credstash platform
Centralized access management using Google Groups
Providing a testing platform for Credstash before production deployment

name: Credstash V2 - Access Management Guide.txt - Production Credstash
description: This section provides information about the production environment of Credstash, a tool used for securely storing and retrieving credentials. It lists the URLs for accessing the Credstash user interface in different clusters (Main Production, DE Cluster, and RazorpayX Cluster). It also mentions the Google Groups associated with different roles (Developers, Tech Leads, and Engineering Managers) for accessing and managing Credstash.
use_cases: Accessing the Credstash user interface in the production environment
Managing access to Credstash based on roles and responsibilities
Collaborating and communicating within teams through Google Groups
